alicesOpening.line: Alice: Are you going to ask me for help in borrowing something?

lines.line: Marisa: Man, I'm so bored. I just might find something to borrow! Interested?
Alice: If... you're going to let me work with you just this once, I might as well.
Marisa: Now y'er just encouragin' me.
Marisa: But actually, I'm so good at borrowing that it's hard to find things that are worth the challenge.
Marisa: That's why I'm not doin' it as much nowadays.
Alice: Well, at long last. I might as well tell everyone to leave their doors wide open.
Marisa: Obviously, I was lying.
Marisa: The world's never short on things to borrow.
Alice: Oh dear. I should've seen that coming.
Marisa: (Grin)

alicesOpening.line: Why don't you tell me about the latest thing in your 'borrow' list?

lines.line: Marisa: There's somethin' I've been wantin' to wanna borrow lately.
Alice: And it's something that gets you excited enough to tell me about it?
Marisa: I wouldn't make light of it. I had to convince myself that I want it too.
Alice: Ugh. And somehow I'm the drama queen.
Marisa: Ya ever wondered if there's something as precious to me...
Marisa: ...as your doll research is to you?
Alice: Oh... I wouldn't have known.
Marisa: (Sweats)
Alice: Do you need my help in borrowing it?
Marisa: I did say earlier that I ought'a borrow more things from ya.
Alice: Wait. W-Where is this going?
Marisa: That's a good question...
Alice: ...

alicesOpening.line: Alice: Hey, have you talked to the weirdo who's always hoarding items?

lines.line: Marisa: I stopped by Kourindou the other day.
Alice: The weirdo who's always hoarding items?
Marisa: The way you describe it... Well if it ain't me, it's Rinnosuke.
Alice: I'm sure he has lots of materials for my doll research.
Alice: But he's so hard to approach.
Marisa: Yeah, not the friendliest.
Alice: It sure takes guts for you to step inside the shop, being a known thief and all.
Marisa: Geez, get me off this pedestal.
Alice: Oh it's a pedestal all right. A pedestal for honoring thieves.
Marisa: So anyway, Rinnosuke was just tellin' me.
Marisa: How frustratin' it is to be not quite human, and also not quite youkai either.
Marisa: He said it's hard to know the value of life, given how long it is.
Marisa: And since it's still a short life for a youkai, he feels kinda restricted.
Alice: Oh, that's interesting. I've never thought of it that way.
Marisa: Ya better go visit his shop at least once before he kicks the bucket.
Alice: Why would I do that when I can just ask you to go there for me?
Marisa: (Frown)

alicesOpening.line: Alice: So, you seem awfully free these days.

lines.line: Marisa: I want to tell you somethin'. It's about my super amazing deadly evil scheme.
Alice: But you seem awfully free these days.
Marisa: Why thank you, it's hard puttin' up this facade.
Marisa: Just wait till you hear about it. My super deadly evil schem-o.
Alice: Okay... What evil scheme are you working on?
Marisa: It's also called, my super deadly secret evil schem-o.
Alice: Okay, Miss 'I'm gonna tell you all about it.'
Marisa: Haha... Gotcha there...! Haha.

alicesOpening.line: Are you living up to your evil witch identity? You know, maybe stealing's not enough.

lines.line: Marisa: I still didn't tell ya about my evil scheme.
Alice: Your evil scheme better involve something beyond stealing.
Marisa: Good point.
Marisa: I was thinkin' about what Rinnosuke said, and he's kinda right.
Marisa: I've got nothin' on all you youkai. Just a short-lived human right here.
Marisa: No matter how good you are at borrowing, ya can't borrow more time.
Alice: ...
Alice: Oh please. What's with all this gloom and doom?
Marisa: Hey, I'm not sad about it. There's always somethin' to make it worthwhile.
Marisa: That's exactly what my evil scheme is for.
Alice: This better not be some half-baked treachery.
Marisa: Don' 'cha go judgin' before you even know it.
Alice: Won't you involve me in it somehow?
Marisa: Ahahaha...!
Marisa: Okay, you win alright? I'll tell you my evil scheme.
Marisa: I'll be needin' your cooperation, so ya better listen carefully.
Alice: J-Just what are you getting at?
Marisa: The evil scheme is to hold that hand over there. (Points)
Alice: W-W-What?
Alice: Marisa, y-you're too bold for your own good.
Alice: (Joins hands with Marisa)
Marisa: Nyeheheh...
Alice: W-Well?
Alice: Isn't there a trick behind this?
Marisa: No way. Geez, not everything I do has to be ironic.
Marisa: But you wouldn't 've agreed to this if you didn't take me seriously just this once.
Alice: You're just lucky you didn't misjudge my feelings.
Marisa: Who do think I am? (Aww yes!!)

alicesOpening.line: Alice: Now, what's the next strange place that you'll bring this discussion into?

lines.line: Marisa: It's been a while since that geyser incident, huh?
Alice: Yes, but it hasn't been a while since you last brought up topics at random.
Marisa: Don' 'cha go blamin' me for it.
Marisa: If only there's a bunch'a more things to talk to ya about.
Alice: No one ever told you to team up with me just two times in history.
Marisa: (Frown)
Marisa: Ya know, I just realized.
Marisa: That geyser incident was one of the few times I borrowed somethin' from you.
Alice: Congratulations on returning my dolls in one piece.
Alice: If you hadn't done so, you wouldn't be here talking to me.
Marisa: I really ought'a borrow more things from ya.
Marisa: What do you call a life if it isn't lived dangerously?

alicesOpening.line: Alice: I still can't get over you calling my dolls a 'bunch'a robots.'

lines.line: Marisa: Did ya make your dolls into robots yet?
Alice: Fully-autonomous doesn't mean robot, you dummy!
Marisa: Alright, point taken.
Marisa: You do take a lotta pride in your doll autonomy research.
Alice: You should look forward to the end product. My doll would be very happy to meet you.
Alice: Just so you know, I don't infuse my dolls with ghosts or spirits, because, I'm not a cheater.
Marisa: This is gonna be a treat. Seeing this all the way to the end.
Marisa: ...Ever thought about what'cha gonna do after you finish your doll research?
Alice: No, I have not. When you become engrossed in something, everything else is just a distraction.
Marisa: Can't really screw up on something so precious to you.
Alice: Are you trying to jinx it?
Marisa: Hurk!
Marisa: The thing I wanna borrow is your heart, Alice.
Alice: W-W-What?
Marisa: Y-Yeah. Was that too sudden?
Alice: Geez, c-can't you be more blunt about it?
Marisa: I'm not the kind that sits around waitin' all day.
Alice: So you're mean it's only a recent thing.
Alice: That's funny... For me, it's goes back very far.
Marisa: Oh? ...Sorry for not catchin' on back then.
Alice: You're really dim-witted, you know that?
Marisa: Nyehehe...
Marisa: Hey, wanna go out with me?
Alice: (Sigh)
Alice: Don't you ever get tired of your pranks?
Marisa: Wait, I'm being serious, I swear!
Alice: ...

alicesOpening.line: Alice: (Notices Marisa staring at the sky)

lines.line: Marisa: Sure is nice out huh?
Alice: ...
Marisa: I sure wish it comes down hard soon.
Alice: It will in about 8 hours. And it will drop 4 degrees in the meantime.
Alice: Predicting the weather is only the most basic of the basics for a magician.
Marisa: I haven't been slacking, I swear!
Marisa: Anyway, it wouldn't make sense to make small talk about the weather huh?
Alice: Yes. You're not making any sense right now.
Marisa: L-Let's move on.
